variables.description: Unique identifer for the study, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Study Code

variables.description: Unique INCLUDE global identifier for the participant, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Participant Global ID

variables.description: Unique, de-identified identifier for the participant, assigned by data contributor. External IDs must be two steps removed from personal information in the study records.
variables.name: Participant External ID

variables.description: Unique identifer for family to which Participant belongs, assigned by data contributor
variables.name: Family ID

variables.description: Structure of family members participating in the study
variables.name: Family Type

variables.description: Participant External ID for Participant's father (NA if Participant is not the proband)
variables.name: Father ID

variables.description: Participant External ID for Participant's mother (NA if Participant is not the proband)
variables.name: Mother ID

variables.description: Participant External ID for Participant's sibling(s) (NA if Participant is not the proband)
variables.name: Sibling ID

variables.description: Participant External ID for Participant's other family members (NA if Participant is not the proband)
variables.name: Other Family Member ID

variables.description: Relationship of Participant to proband
variables.name: Family Relationship

variables.description: Sex of Participant
variables.name: Sex

variables.description: Race of Participant

enumerations.code: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
enumerations.description: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

variables.name: Race

variables.description: Ethnicity of Participant
variables.name: Ethnicity

variables.description: Down Syndrome status of participant
variables.name: Down Syndrome Status

variables.description: Age in days of Participant at first recorded study event (enrollment, visit, observation, sample collection, survey completion, etc.). Age at enrollment is preferred, if available.
variables.name: Age at First Patient Engagement

variables.description: Event for which Age at First Patient Engagement is given (e.g. enrollment, visit, observation, sample collection, survey completion, etc.). Age at enrollment is preferred, if available.
variables.name: First Patient Engagement Event

variables.description: Whether participant is alive or dead
variables.name: Outcomes Vital Status

variables.description: Age in days when participant's vital status was last recorded
variables.name: Age at Last Vital Status

variables.description: Unique, de-identified identifier for the participant, assigned by data contributor. External IDs must be two steps removed from personal information in the study records.
variables.name: Participant External ID

variables.description: Identifier for event (Visit, Survey completion, Sample collection, etc.) to which the Condition data are linked, if applicable. There may be multiple events linked to a Participant.
variables.name: Event ID

variables.description: Type of event for which Event ID is given (Visit, Survey completion, Sample collection, etc.)
variables.name: Event Type

variables.description: Co-occurring Condition (phenotype or diagnosis) or Measure (observation with numeric value), as described by data contributor. The Down Syndrome Genetic Diagnosis will be rolled into this field.
variables.name: Condition or Measure Source Text

variables.description: Age in days at which Condition or Measure was observed, recorded, or diagnosed
variables.name: Age At Condition or Measure Observation

variables.description: Whether Condition was observed or not
variables.name: Condition Interpretation

variables.description: Whether the Condition is ongoing, has been resolved, or this is a general history of the condition without known dates
variables.name: Condition Status

variables.description: Whether Condition information was obtained by the investigator or reported by participant/family member
variables.name: Condition Data Source

variables.description: Label for Condition in the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)
variables.name: HPO Label

variables.description: Code for Condition in the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)
variables.name: HPO Code

variables.description: Label for Condition in the Mondo Disease Ontology (MONDO)
variables.name: MONDO Label

variables.description: Code for Condition in the Mondo Disease Ontology (Mondo)
variables.name: MONDO Code

variables.description: Label for Condition in the Medical Action Ontology (MAXO)
variables.name: MAXO Label

variables.description: Code for condition in the Medical Action Ontology (MAXO)
variables.name: MAXO Code

variables.description: Label for Condition in another ontology (if no match in HPO, MONDO, or MAXO)
variables.name: Other Label

variables.description: Code for Condition in another ontology (if no match in HPO, MONDO, or MAXO)
variables.name: Other Code

variables.description: Numeric value of Measure
variables.name: Measure Value

variables.description: Unit that is associated with Measure Value (e.g. kg, cm, %, x10^9/L, etc.)
variables.name: Measure Unit

variables.description: Unique INCLUDE global identifier for the participant, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Participant Global ID

variables.description: Unique, de-identified identifier for the participant, assigned by data contributor. External IDs must be two steps removed from personal information in the study records.
variables.name: Participant External ID

variables.description: Age in days of participant at time of biospecimen collection
variables.name: Age at Biospecimen Collection

variables.description: INCLUDE global identifier for sample, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Sample Global ID

variables.description: Unique identifier for sample, assigned by data contributor. A sample is a unique biological material; two samples with two different IDs are biologically distinct.
variables.name: Sample External ID

variables.description: Type of biological material comprising the Sample (e.g. Plasma, White blood cells, Red blood cells, DNA, RNA, Peripheral blood mononuclear cells, CD4+ Tconv cells, NK cells, Monocytes, CD8+ T cells, B cells, Granulocytes, Treg cells)
variables.name: Sample Type

variables.description:
Whether or not the sample is potentially available for sharing through
      the Virtual Biorepository
variables.name: Sample Availability

variables.description: INCLUDE global identifier for the eldest sample in a lineage, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Collection Global ID

variables.description:
Identifier for the eldest sample in a lineage of processed, pooled,
      or aliquoted samples - typically the material actually collected from the Participant. This may be the same as Parent Sample ID or Sample ID
      (if no processing was performed). Assigned by data contributor.
variables.name: Collection External ID

variables.description: Type of biological material comprising the Collected Sample (e.g. Whole blood, Not reported, Saliva, Derived cell line)
variables.name: Collection Sample Type

variables.description: INCLUDE global identifier for specific container/aliquot of sample, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Container Global ID

variables.description:
Identifier for specific container/aliquot of sample, assigned by data contributor.
      For example, distinct aliquots of a sample will have the same Sample ID but
      different Container IDs.
variables.name: Container External ID

variables.description: Container Availability
variables.name: Container Availability

variables.description: INCLUDE global identifier for the direct parent from which Sample was derived, assigned by DCC
variables.name: Parent Sample Global ID

variables.description: Unique identifier for the parent sample, assigned by data contributor
variables.name: Parent Sample External ID

variables.description: Type of biological material comprising the Parent Sample (e.g. Peripheral Whole Blood, Derived Cell Line, Saliva, Whole blood, WBCs)
variables.name: Parent Sample Type

variables.description: Procedure by which Sample was derived from Parent Sample (e.g. Centrifugation, RBC lysis, Lyse/fix buffer, FACS, PAXgene DNA, PAXgene RNA, Qiagen Allprep, Ficoll)
variables.name: Laboratory Procedure

variables.description: Sample Availability where In indcates available and Out indicates Unavailable
variables.name: In/Out

variables.description: Method by which Container is stored (e.g. Minus 80 degrees Celsius, Liquid nitrogen storage)
variables.name: Biospecimen Storage

variables.description: Concentration of sample in container
variables.name: Concentration

variables.description: Unit of sample concentration
variables.name: Concentration_Unit

variables.description: Amount of sample in container
variables.name: Volume

variables.description: Unit of sample volume
variables.name: Volume Unit

study.description: The Crnic Institute Human Trisome Project® (HTP) is an in-depth study of people with Down syndrome using the latest technologies in precision medicine.
study.title: Crnic Institute Human Trisome Project
